title: New York DMV Driver (D) Practice Test

test.question: You may cross a single solid white line in the highway:
test.A: A. Whenever you want to
test.B: B. If traffic conditions require
test.C: C. Only to turn into a driveway
test.D: D. Only to make a u-turn

test.question: As you near an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow.  Your best action would be to:
test.A: A. Speed up to beat the red light
test.B: B. Apply the brakes sharply to stop
test.C: C. Be prepared to stop in the center of the intersection
test.D: D. Be prepared to stop before the intersection

test.question: Which of the following must you obey over the other three?
test.A: A. A steady red light
test.B: B. A policeman
test.C: C. A stop sign
test.D: D. A flashing red light

test.question: You may cross a double solid yellow line:
test.A: A. To pass a slow moving truck
test.B: B. To turn into a driveway
test.C: C. To pass a car if traffic permits
test.D: D. Under no conditions

test.question: You may not cross a single broken white (or yellow) line:
test.A: A. When to do so would interfere with traffic
test.B: B. When turning left into a driveway
test.C: C. When the car in front is disabled
test.D: D. When passing to the right on a one-way street

test.question: What are the colors of a sign which tells you the distance to the next exit of a highway?
test.A: A. Yellow with black letters
test.B: B. Black with white letters
test.C: C. Red with white letters
test.D: D. Green with white letters

test.question: A traffic light which has a green arrow and a red light means that:
test.A: A. You may only drive straight ahead
test.B: B. You may drive only in the direction of the green arrow
test.C: C. You must wait for a green light
test.D: D. Vehicles moving in any direction must stop

test.question: What are the colors of the warning signs that indicate hazards ahead, such as curves in the road or narrow bridges?
test.A: A. Black letters or symbols on a white background
test.B: B. Black letters or symbols on a yellow background
test.C: C. White letters or symbols on a blue background
test.D: D. White letters or symbols on a green background

test.question: You come to an intersection which has a flashing red light.  You should:
test.A: A. Come to a full stop, then go when safe to do so
test.B: B. Stop only if cars are approaching the intersection
test.C: C. Stop only if cars are already in the intersection
test.D: D. Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary

test.question: An intersection has a stop sign and a crosswalk, but no stop line.  You must stop:
test.A: A. Before the crosswalk
test.B: B. 50 feet before the intersection
test.C: C. Where you think the stop line would be
test.D: D. With your front wheels in the crosswalk

test.question: When the road is marked with a solid yellow line and a broken yellow line on your side you may pass:
test.A: A. Only in an emergency
test.B: B. If you are on an expressway
test.C: C. If traffic is clear
test.D: D. Only at an intersection

test.question: A rectangular-shaped sign is a:
test.A: A. Railroad crossing sign
test.B: B. School crossing sign
test.C: C. Speed limit sign
test.D: D. Stop sign

test.question: What does a flashing yellow light mean?
test.A: A. Merging traffic
test.B: B. Proceed with caution
test.C: C. Pedestrian crossing
test.D: D. Come to a full stop

test.question: What does this road sign mean?
test.A: A. Slow down and prepare to stop only if cars are approaching you
test.B: B. Come to a full stop, then go when it is safe to do so
test.C: C. Proceed carefully through the intersection, not always stopping
test.D: D. Stop only for traffic on an intersecting road

test.question: A diamond-shaped sign is a:
test.A: A. Road hazard sign
test.B: B. Interstate route site
test.C: C. School crossing sign
test.D: D. Speed limit sign

test.question: A solid white line on the right edge of the highway slants in toward your left.  This shows that:
test.A: A. There is an intersection just ahead
test.B: B. You are approaching a construction area
test.C: C. You will be required to turn left just ahead
test.D: D. The road will get narrower

test.question: A red and white triangular sign at an intersection means:
test.A: A. Always come to a full stop at the intersection
test.B: B. Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
test.C: C. Slow down if an emergency vehicle is approaching
test.D: D. Look both ways as you cross the intersection

test.question: Which of the following is used on some highways to direct drivers into the proper lanes for turning?
test.A: A. Flashing red lights
test.B: B. Flashing yellow lights
test.C: C. White lines on the side of the road
test.D: D. White arrows in the middle of the lanes

test.question: The driver's left arm and hand are extended downward.  This hand signal means that the driver plans to:
test.A: A. Turn left
test.B: B. Turn right
test.C: C. Stop
test.D: D. Start up

test.question: You must pull over and stop for:
test.A: A. Vehicles that display blue, green or amber lights
test.B: B. Authorized emergency vehicles responding to emergencies
test.C: C. A hazard vehicle that is parked, stopped or standing on any part of the highway
test.D: D. Stopped or standing school buses

test.question: What should you do when you are going to enter a roadway from a private road?
test.A: A. Blow your horn to warn cars you are entering the roadway
test.B: B. Stop with part of the car on the roadway to warn other drivers
test.C: C. Drive out fast to merge smoothly with the traffic
test.D: D. Yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and roadway traffic

test.question: You come to an intersection which is blocked by other traffic.  You should:
test.A: A. Go slowly until the traffic ahead moves
test.B: B. Get as close as possible to the other car
test.C: C. Stay out of the intersection until you can pass through
test.D: D. Sound your horn to make the cars move up

test.question: You want to turn right at the next intersection.  You should begin to use your turn signal:
test.A: A. At least 50 feet before the turn
test.B: B. When you reach the intersection
test.C: C. At least 100 feet before you turn
test.D: D. As soon as you see cars behind you

test.question: When you want to make a right turn, your car must be:
test.A: A. Near the center of the street
test.B: B. Close to the left side of the street
test.C: C. Close to the right side of the street
test.D: D. Past the center of the intersection when you begin to turn

test.question: You are making a left turn away from a two-way street into a one-way street.  When you have completed the turn your car should be:
test.A: A. In the right lane of the street
test.B: B. In the center of the street
test.C: C. In the left lane of the street
test.D: D. In the lane with the least traffic

test.question: You are waiting in the intersection to complete a left turn.  You should:
test.A: A. Signal and keep your wheels turned to the left
test.B: B. Signal and keep your wheels straight
test.C: C. Flash your headlights so the driver will let you through
test.D: D. Drive around the rear of a car if it blocks you

test.question: The driver's left hand and arm are extended upward.  This hand signal means that the driver plans to:
test.A: A. Turn left
test.B: B. Turn right
test.C: C. Come to a stop
test.D: D. Go straight ahead

test.question: You drive along a street and hear a siren.  You cannot immediately see the emergency vehicle.  You should:
test.A: A. Keep driving until you see the vehicle
test.B: B. Pull to the curb and look to see if it is on your street
test.C: C. Slow down but don't stop until you see it
test.D: D. Speed up and turn at the next intersection

test.question: When two vehicles enter an intersection from different highways at the same time, which vehicle must yield the right-of-way?
test.A: A. Either one
test.B: B. Vehicle on the left
test.C: C. Vehicle on the right
test.D: D. Neither one

test.question: When you see an emergency vehicle parked, stopped, or standing with its emergency or hazard lights activated on a highway or parkway, you should:
test.A: A. Move out of the lane closest to the emergency vehicle, if possible to do so safely
test.B: B. Make a U-turn to avoid the vehicle
test.C: C. Maintain your speed and lane position if possible
test.D: D. Stop behind the vehicle and activate your hazard lights

test.question: The law that requires every driver to exercise care to avoid colliding with an authorized emergency or hazard vehicle is called:
test.A: A. Brianna’s Law
test.B: B. The Green Light Law
test.C: C. Move Over Law
test.D: D. Right of Way

test.question: You must yield the right-of-way to an approaching vehicle when you are:
test.A: A. Already in a traffic circle
test.B: B. Already in an intersection
test.C: C. Going straight ahead
test.D: D. Turning left

test.question: You want to turn left at an intersection.  The light is green but oncoming traffic is heavy.  You should:
test.A: A. Use the next intersection
test.B: B. Wait at the crosswalk for traffic to clear
test.C: C. Wait in the center of the intersection for traffic to clear
test.D: D. Take the right-of-way since you have the light

test.question: You have the right of way when you are:
test.A: A. Entering a traffic circle
test.B: B. Backing out of a driveway
test.C: C. Leaving a parking space
test.D: D. Already in a traffic circle

test.question: What does it mean when a school bus is stopped and its red lights are flashing?
test.A: A. You may pass if no children are on the road
test.B: B. You may not pass while the red lights are flashing
test.C: C. You may pass if you are facing the front of the bus
test.D: D. You may pass if it is on the other side of a divided highway

test.question: After you have passed a car you should return to the right lane when you:
test.A: A. See the front bumper of the other car in your mirror
test.B: B. Have put your turn signal on
test.C: C. Have turned your headlights on
test.D: D. See the other car's headlights come on

test.question: When you want to overtake and pass another vehicle you should:
test.A: A. Wait for a signal from the other driver
test.B: B. Change lanes quickly so the other driver will see you
test.C: C. Signal and pass when safe to do so
test.D: D. Stay close behind so you need less time to pass

test.question: You are driving in the middle lane on a three lane expressway.  A car begins to pass you on the right.  The actions of that driver are:
test.A: A. Wrong because "pass on the left" is a firm rule
test.B: B. Wrong because he's passing you in your "blind spot"
test.C: C. OK as long as he does it on a limited access highway
test.D: D. OK if no signs forbid passing on the right

test.question: The car behind you begins to pass you.  You should:
test.A: A. Maintain your speed so traffic will flow smoothly
test.B: B. Pull to the right and stop so he can pass
test.C: C. Slow down slightly and stay in your lane
test.D: D. Blow your horn to allow him to pass

test.question: In general, you should pass vehicles going in the same direction you are going:
test.A: A. On the right
test.B: B. On the left
test.C: C. Only if the other driver signals it is safe
test.D: D. Whenever you have the opportunity to do so

test.question: In which of the following situations is passing always forbidden?
test.A: A. The vehicle ahead is making a left turn
test.B: B. You are on a one-way street which has two lanes
test.C: C. The vehicle ahead is stopped for a pedestrian in a crosswalk
test.D: D. The vehicle ahead is going to park parallel to the curb

test.question: You may pass another vehicle on the right if it is waiting to:
test.A: A. Turn right
test.B: B. Turn left
test.C: C. Park at the curb
test.D: D. Turn into a driveway on the right

test.question: A "no standing" sign at a certain location means:
test.A: A. You may never stop your vehicle there
test.B: B. You may park there if the driver remains in the vehicle
test.C: C. You may stop temporarily to pick up or discharge passengers
test.D: D. You may stop to load or unload merchandise

test.question: A driver may park in a space reserved for people with disabilities if the vehicle displays license plates for the disabled:
test.A: A. Regardless of who is in the vehicle
test.B: B. Only if the driver is disabled
test.C: C. And is carrying a disabled person named on the registration
test.D: D. If someone in the driver's immediate family is disabled

test.question: A "no stopping" sign means that, unless directed to do so by a policeman, you may stop only:
test.A: A. Long enough to unload packages
test.B: B. To avoid conflict with other traffic
test.C: C. To discharge passengers
test.D: D. For less than 5 minutes

test.question: In a parking space reserved for people with disabilities, a non-disabled driver:
test.A: A. May park in an emergency
test.B: B. May not park, but stop in an emergency
test.C: C. May not park or stop, but may stand in an emergency
test.D: D. May neither park, stop, nor stand

test.question: Before you leave a parking space which is parallel to the curb, you should:
test.A: A. Sound your horn
test.B: B. Turn on your four-way flasher
test.C: C. Look for traffic by turning your head
test.D: D. Look for traffic by using your inside rear-view mirror

test.question: If you are parked parallel to the curb, you may get out of the car on the traffic side:
test.A: A. During the daytime when other drivers can see you
test.B: B. When the traffic light at the closest intersection turns red
test.C: C. When you won't interfere with oncoming vehicles
test.D: D. If you use your four-way flasher first

test.question: Assuming that the street is level, what should you do after you have finished parallel parking in a space between two other cars?
test.A: A. Leave your front wheels turned toward the curb
test.B: B. Make sure your car almost touches the car behind you
test.C: C. Move as far forward in the space as possible
test.D: D. Straighten your front wheels and leave room between cars

test.question: A "no parking" sign at a certain location means:
test.A: A. You may never stop your vehicle there
test.B: B. You may stop temporarily to load or unload passengers
test.C: C. You may park there if the driver remains in the vehicle
test.D: D. You may leave your vehicle unattended for less than 5 minutes

test.question: You may never park:
test.A: A. On a one-way street
test.B: B. At the entrance of a building
test.C: C. In a crosswalk
test.D: D. Within 50 feet of a fire hydrant

test.question: One of the rules of defensive driving is:
test.A: A. Look straight ahead as you drive
test.B: B. Stay alert and keep your eyes moving
test.C: C. Expect that other drivers will make up for your errors
test.D: D. Be confident that you can avoid danger at the last minute

test.question: Signs that warn "lane closed ahead" may indicate a work zone ahead. You should:
test.A: A. Merge your vehicle into the correct lane when it is safe
test.B: B. Drive to the end of the closed lane before attempting to merge
test.C: C. Understand that this sign is merely a suggestion and continue in the lane
test.D: D. Speed up to merge as quickly as possible

test.question: Seat belts can be most effective as injury preventive devices when they are worn by:
test.A: A. The person driving the car
test.B: B. Passengers when they are on a long drive
test.C: C. All occupants of a car being driven on an expressway
test.D: D. Passengers and the driver whenever they are in the car

test.question: Minimum speed signs are designed to:
test.A: A. Keep traffic flowing smoothly
test.B: B. Show current local road conditions
test.C: C. Test future traffic signal needs
test.D: D. Assure pedestrian safety

test.question: Which of the following may describe a work zone sign?
test.A: A. A white rectangle with black letters
test.B: B. An orange diamond with black letters
test.C: C. A green rectangle with white letters
test.D: D. A yellow circle with black letters

test.question: Driving in a state of rage can:
test.A: A. Affect your ability to reason and make decisions
test.B: B. Increase the chance of being involved in a traffic accident
test.C: C. Lead to a revoked or suspended license
test.D: D. All of these choices

test.question: What is true of work zones?
test.A: A. They are always stationary and therefore easily avoided
test.B: B. They are only dangerous at night
test.C: C. Speeding fines are tripled when workers are present
test.D: D. Rear-end collisions are the most common type of crash in work zones

test.question: A safe speed to drive your car:
test.A: A. Is the posted speed limit
test.B: B. Is less than the posted speed limit
test.C: C. Depends on the weather and road conditions
test.D: D. Depends on the mechanical skill of the driver

test.question: On long trips you can prevent drowsiness by:
test.A: A. Turning on your car radio
test.B: B. Slowing down so you can react better
test.C: C. Stopping at regular intervals for a rest
test.D: D. Moving your eyes from side to side as you drive

test.question: Which of the following is always true about road rage?
test.A: A. There is nothing a driver can do to prevent road rage
test.B: B. You must hold your position in your travel lane
test.C: C. Only violent people experience road rage
test.D: D. You should remain polite to aggressive drivers

test.question: Aggressive driving can become road rage. What should you do when confronted by an aggressive driver?
test.A: A. Speed up to pass the driver as quickly as possible
test.B: B. Be prepared to yield the right of way
test.C: C. Drink alcohol to calm yourself down
test.D: D. Make eye contact with the driver

test.question: On a New York State highway where there is no posted speed limit, the fastest you may legally drive is:
test.A: A. 50 mph
test.B: B. 55 mph
test.C: C. 60 mph
test.D: D. 65 mph
